messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.This person is 56 years old, female, of White descent. They have some college education and an annual income of less than $20,000. English is their first language. They are 26.0 feet tall and weighs 300 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I am intelligent enough about this topic to answer all questions and understand what is being asked.  If I do not understand for some unknown reason I do know who and what to ask
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
It really depends on the doctor.  I have had doctors who are mostly concerned about other things than me.  Then I have had some that seem like they are only interested in me.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
It is only when I have to have women issues addressed that I feel uncomfortable. It is all in my mind because I know these doctors have seen it all before and I am nothing different
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
My sister has ms and I did allot of research on this subject.  Just to see how it fit with her symptoms and how it is going to progress

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust my doctor as she listens to my concerns and addresses them with testing and the specialist I need. I have became better health wise since being under this doctors care
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
When I have symptoms associated with diseases that are tough to treat. I have lung disease so especially worried when I get a infection
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When I had cervical spine surgery. The surgeon explained everything in full so I naturally had a little fear as it was my spinal cord they were  operating on

the blood test an how they are going to come back when dealing with cancerit to wait can be very nerving

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

Doctors don't really seem to take their time with the patients, that's usually the nurses job, so they don;t seem to care too much or the cherry-picked the patients they went to care about..and I generally don't just anyone that pushes unnecessary medications and treatment on their patients so they can line their pockets or an money for their hospital.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I'm not worried just cautious and aware..educated...

I just do a lot of research. I read a lot of books on medicine, illnesses and the medical profession and ethics. I watch a lot of documentaries on the topic also and my mother was a nurse.

ALWAYS AFAIRD SOMETHING IS WRONG WHEN I HAVE TESTS, ALWAYS ANXIOUS WHAT THE SCALE WILL SAY.  BUT IN THE END IM ALWAYS FEEL BETTER WHEN I LEAVE AND HAVE MY ANSWERS

MY LAST OPERATION, SIMPLE KNEE REPLACEMENT SURGRY, DUE TO POOR DOCTORING I WAS IN FOR 14 DAYS WITH KNEE, STOMACH BLEEDING, PNEUOMIA AND KIDNEY FAILFURE.  TOO MANY DOCTORS GIVING ME DIFFERENT THINGS.

In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I trust what is said, but sometimes I feel like I am not a person to my doctor, and he could misread my symptoms.

My cadets used to have breathing problems occasionally when we would exercise. Sometimes they passed out. It was my duty to help them stabalize.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel that there is sufficient explanation and help sources when it comes to understanding basic health information. The key really is keep it simple. Avoid big medical terms. I will check the internet also before making a decision.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

All in all over the years going to the doctor has been a pleasant experience. The doctors I have visited have been kind and helpful. One reason I think I have such a positive opinion of doctors is because I rarely use them.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
If I am not feeling well not knowing what is causing me to feel ill makes me anxious and worried. After the prognosis and diagnosis I start to settle down and relax.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

Eating right is the key to good health. It's not a apple a day keeps the doctor away. It's eat plenty of fruits and vegetables and reduce your meat intake and exercise keeps you away from the doctors.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I believe that although the system can be complicated, I am capable of making appropriate health decisions. I can ask for clarification and help with forms and acquire more information about topics and conditions being discussed.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
I find my doctor to be very trustworthy. He is open and honest with me and make things easy to understand.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
When I have something wrong and the doctor takes a long time to figure out what it is. Though I suppose the worst is worrying about the cost of the procedure.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I was able to read the information about my prescription and figure out what the side effects actually meant. This helped me to decide if I should stay on the prescription or not.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.This person is 34 years old, male, of White descent. They have some college education and an annual income of $55,000 - $74,999. English is their first language. They are 25.0 feet tall and weighs 165 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I feel very confident that I can understand basic health information. I haven't had any recent issues or bad experiences with understanding medical information nor have I had any issues in the past. This includes issues for myself and both of my parents who have also had their share of issues.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
My doctor always gives it to me straight. He doesn't dance around or mince words.  I trust him for that. He's always open and gives options and opinions about the options. O respect him for that.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I usually get good reports for the most part. Unknown is always worrisome. Something can happen that is unexpected and you can take things for granted. Health is always one of those things. My doctor does a good job of not keeping me in the dark about anything but you always worry about the what if. Mortality is a scary concept. Worry about what happens to my family is something goes wrong. Worry about how to pay large medical bills even though I have good insurance. No matter how prepared you think you are I don't think anything can prepare you for a very bad medical report.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

I have several fruit allergies including bananas, kiwi, strawberries, and grapes. As a young child we did not know this. When I would eat any of these items individually I would get a mild upset stomach however one day my mom gave me bananas and kiwi cut up on a plate for a snack. After eating most of it i had shortness of breath and hives on my chest. I knew I was having an allergic reaction and needed help. I've seen an lergic reaction from my cousin who cannot have milk but one day decided to try it. I let my mom know and she gave me benadryl which countered the symptoms.

You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.This person is 36 years old, male, of White descent. They have some college education and an annual income of $35,000 - $54,999. English is their first language. They are 38.0 feet tall and weighs 175 pounds.

Regarding all the questions you just answered, to what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I lack confidence when trying to process information related to health and wellness. I find that the words and techniques are in a language that only people in the medical field can understand fully. There is a lot of technical jargon contained in the materials that average people usually cannot understand. I usually have to rely on speaking directly to my doctor or nurse to make sure that I understand what is being said. There are only a few websites that are dedicated to explaining medical terminology and even these can be complicated to understand.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I have a lot of trust in my primary care physician. I have been with this same doctor since I was a child and he has been very courteous and helpful with my medical needs. My doctor is located in a small facility so there are not that many patients he sees in a day. The care is very personal and positive. He has a way of talking to people that is very relaxing and comforting to everyone he sees. There has never been a time that I have doubted the advice or treatment he has given me.
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I would feel anxious or worried about a doctors visit if I had a strange pain or feeling in my body that I haven't had before. Not knowing what could be the cause of the pain or illness would make me worried about what the diagnosis could be. I would slightly doubt the doctor fully understands what I am feeling and if the treatment would be the correct procedure for me. I would not feel anxious or worried if I was just going in for a regular checkup or follow up. Only when I am experiencing something I have never experienced is when I would start to worry.
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

A few years ago I had a friend that was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer and she was admitted into a cancer treatment center. She was very worried about what kind of processes and procedures she would go through. I was able to talk to her about what she may experience because my father was also diagnosed with cancer and I watched him suffer through it for 6 months going through all sorts of different treatments. Because of my experience with my father I was able to talk to my friend about what she can expect and how hard the process is going to be.

To a great extent I.do trust doctors a great amount. I think they are smart and very particular about what resources that.they use
In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I feel this way about different things that I like to express. I worry about things just like everybody else
In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
Im not really sure of a situtation I would put myself in that I could give you a story of that nature
